description: Composability matrix for QEM/QES techniques. Each entry indicates whether two techniques can be composed, and in what order. 'inner' means the row technique is applied first (closer to the circuit), 'outer' means the column technique wraps around it.

matrix.notes: DD suppresses idle noise, ZNE extrapolates residual gate noise. Well-studied combination.
DD reduces baseline noise, lowering PEC overhead.
DD as preprocessing before layerwise extrapolation.
PT converts coherent errors to stochastic, making ZNE extrapolation more reliable.
PT simplifies noise to Pauli channel, reducing PEC characterization cost. Standard pipeline.
PT as preprocessing for more predictable noise scaling.
Both are circuit-level transforms. Order depends on noise structure.
ZNE handles gate noise, REM corrects readout. REM applied last (post-measurement).
PEC handles gate noise, REM corrects readout. Standard full-circuit mitigation.
CDR corrects gate noise, REM corrects readout independently.

matrix.order: SV then ZNE or ZNE then SV
matrix.notes: SV post-selects valid outcomes; ZNE extrapolates remaining noise. Order flexible.
Symmetry constraints can define the subspace for expansion.
LRE is a generalization of ZNE. Using both is redundant.
Both address gate noise independently. Composing is not standard and benefits are unclear.
Variable-noise CDR uses ZNE-style noise scaling as input features for regression.
VD purifies state, REM corrects readout errors on the purified measurement.
QSE corrects state errors, REM corrects measurement errors.
DD suppresses gate/idle noise, REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
PT tailors gate noise, REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
QED post-selects error-free runs, ZNE extrapolates residual noise on surviving data.
QED detects gate errors, REM corrects readout errors. Independent stages.
Both are post-selection methods; symmetry checks can complement code-based detection.
Accreditation certifies the quality of ZNE-mitigated results.
Accreditation certifies the quality of PEC-mitigated results.
ZNE handles gate noise, TREX corrects readout. TREX applied last (post-measurement).
PEC handles gate noise, TREX corrects readout independently.
PEA amplifies gate noise for ZNE, TREX corrects readout independently.
DD suppresses gate/idle noise, TREX corrects readout. Independent stages.
PEA is the noise amplification method used inside ZNE. They are used together by design.
PEA and PEC use the same learned noise model for different purposes. PEA amplifies noise for ZNE; PEC cancels it. Using both is redundant.
DD suppresses idle noise, PEA+ZNE handles residual gate noise.
PT tailors noise to Pauli channel, PEA learns and amplifies it for ZNE.
DD suppresses idle noise, NOX extrapolates residual gate noise using learned model.
PT tailors noise to Pauli channel, NOX learns and amplifies it for extrapolation.
NOX handles gate noise via extrapolation, TREX corrects readout errors independently.
NOX handles gate noise, REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
Echo verification provides error detection; CDR learns noise correction. Powerful combined technique.
EV post-selects verified runs; ZNE extrapolates residual noise on surviving data.
EV handles gate errors via verification; REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
EV handles gate errors; TREX corrects readout. Independent stages.
TEM mitigates gate noise via MPO inversion; TREX corrects readout independently.
TEM handles gate noise; REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
Both invert the noise channel. TEM uses tensor network structure; using both is redundant.
ZNE mitigates gate noise; RSE provides noise-resilient observable estimation.
PEC cancels gate noise; RSE provides noise-resilient measurement framework.
CAS avoids crosstalk via scheduling; DD suppresses idle noise. Complementary suppression.
CAS suppresses crosstalk; ZNE extrapolates residual noise.
CAS reduces baseline crosstalk noise; PEC cancels residual gate noise.
NAC optimizes qubit layout; DD suppresses idle noise. Complementary suppression.
NAC reduces baseline noise via routing; ZNE extrapolates residual noise.
NAC handles qubit mapping; CAS handles gate scheduling. Complementary.
DSP purifies state; REM corrects readout errors on purified measurement.
DSP purifies state; TREX corrects readout independently.
ODR rescales gate-noise bias; REM corrects readout. Independent stages.
ODR rescales gate-noise bias; TREX corrects readout independently.
DD suppresses idle noise; ODR rescales residual noise on observables.
